Legal_Issue: Does Article 1E of the United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees apply to exclude applicants from Convention refugee status?
Governing_Law: United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Outcome: Application dismissed; applicants excluded from Convention refugee status
Evidence_Type: Evidence showed their right to return was not lost despite expired visas or destroyed cards
Basis_of_Claim: Applicants claimed refugee status in Canada but had rights in France under Article 1E
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Holding a French 'carte de resident' allowing return within 3 years
Legal_Standard: Article 1E excludes persons recognized by competent authorities as having rights and obligations akin to nationality in their country of residence
Application_Factor: Applicants held a French 'carte de resident'
Decision_Outcome: Applicants excluded from Convention refugee status
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether applicants were excluded under Article 1E based on evidence of their French residency rights
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Article 1E of the United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants had rights and obligations akin to nationality in France
Relevant_Law: United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees, Article 1E
